newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.AFRICAN STOCK MARKET CLOSING REPORT.
newsitem.headline: S.AFRICAN STOCK MARKET CLOSING REPORT.

text.p: South African industrial shares recovered some morning losses to end flat, lifted by local fund buying towards the close while gold shares ended firm on a weaker rand and as bullion headed nearer the $344 level.
"The gold price is a little better and I would say golds had a reasonable day," a dealer commented.
The gold index ended up 24.8 points, or 2.09 percent, to 1,214.1 points.
Most gold shares posted gains, with Freegold rising 60 cents to 30.40 rand, Dries adding 55 cents to 38.30 rand and Western Deep advancing 400 cents to 114 rand.
Industrial shares ended the day flat but off their worst levels after starting soft on a weaker Wall Street.
"The general trend is quietish. We are tracking Wall Street lower," James Scott, equity marketing manager at Societe General Frankel Pollack told Reuters.
Dealers said volumes traded were generally light save for the top six traded shares which included construction group Murray and Roberts Holdings Ltd and which saw institutional and bookover trades.
On Friday, they expected the market to take its cue from Wall Street.
"We will see how Wall Street goes. If it ends better then our market will go stronger," one said.
The industrial index lost 6.2 points to 8,497.4 points and the overall index ended up 2.2 points to 7,162.9 points.
